title: Inspecionar elemento indicando erro na linha errada
content: Quero saber se o que está acontecendo com o meu navegador é um bug do próprio Firefox ou se sou eu que estou louco. Estou testando um código que propositalmente tem um erro de digitação na linha 86:15, porém o navegador está indicando de forma incorreta. Fiquei inseguro de utilizar este navegador em futuros projetos quando houver algum problema porque ele irá me passar incerteza sobre qual o problema. Testei no navegador Vivaldi e ele apontou a linha correta, mas gostaria de utilizar o Firefox...
creator: matheus.a.c.rita

title: Firefox and Twitter (X)
content:
It started today.

I can no longer sign into X if I have my Firefox browser setting "Never Remember History" enabled.

If I enable "Remember History" I can log in to X.

This has never been an issue before and is a bit frustrating.
creator: soniachan669

title: Pages are not loading within Canvas (university page)
content: I'm a university student using a website called canvas to access my uni information and work. Today, whenever I would open a module, the page wouldn't load, meaning that I couldn't access that information at all (refreshing, restarting, and completely turning off my computer did not help). I can access these pages when I checked with microsoft edge, similarly I could access these pages when I accessed them with my laptop (also using Mozilla). The main difference between my pc and laptop is that I had just, today, updated my PC to the latest windows update (2024-05 cumulative update for windows 11 version 23H2 for x64-based systems). I'm not entirely sure if it's a Mozilla problem, but im guessing that something funky is happening to my browser with the latest windows update. I have attached pictures to show whats happening / not happening .
creator: brittanya2002

title: Twitter Tracking Protection
content: Hello, this morning, when opening Twitter we see a warning saying, that Tracking Protection breaks Twitter. Please take a look at that and fix if possible :)
creator: d.gromotka

title: Most sites will not connect due to security issues
content:
I am running Firefox 126.0-1 on an Arch Linux system. Most websites are failing to connect for security reasons.

Some sites, including google.com and nytimes.com, fail with an "SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER" error, and their certificates confirm that they are respectively issued by Google Trust Services LLC and DigiCert Inc.

The website archlinux.org errors with "MOZILLA_PKIX_ERROR_MITM_DETECTED", stating that "Software is Preventing Firefox From Safely Connecting to This Site", citing in particular ISRG Root X1 as the problem. The certificate confirms that it is issued by Let's Encrypt.

The website duckduckgo.com simply errors with "SEC_ERROR_PATH_LEN_CONSTRAINT_INVALID" and states "Secure Connection Failed"

I have confirmed in preferences that my proxy settings are set to "No proxy" and the problem persists across troubleshooting mode and making a new profile. I have also tried removing the cert9.db file in a given profile folder.
creator: david.carlip

title: Latest update glitched firefox unusable
content: Hi After the latest update, the address bar dissapears everytime I click on it to type in an address. It gets hidden behind previous addresses I visited. Completely unusable. I have no idea why it is so bad and how to fix, please help. Thanks
creator: draconesro

title: Reading List Extension?
content: I'm switching to Firefox from Vivaldi since adblocking on YouTube no longer works on Chromium-based browsers, and Google is determined to annoy me even outside of Chrome (they also forced their material design context menus on everything else based on Chromium). However, I'm finding I'm missing the reading list functionality immediately. It has become a basic part of how I browse, and I attempted to use Pocket, but I'm finding that I hate how Pocket works compared to Vivaldi's reading list. Does anyone know of a good extension that emulates how Chromium-based browsers have their reading list, including working with sync so I can pass links between devices?
creator: valeriemdeane

title: bernigaudricardp
content:
Yo hacía mucho tiempo que utilizo Firefox. El problema es que no puedo ver contenido en ninguna de las tres plataformas que tengo (Netflix, HBO i Prime) porque me salen mensajes de errores. El mensaje que me sale de Prime dice que se necesita una versión más nuevas de Firefox, la cual ya tengo. ¿Cómo me puedo hacer para que los pueda ver? ¡Muchas gracias!

Tengo un ordenador con Windows 10.
creator: bernigaudricardo

title: Sync and Save missing from Android
content: I am trying to sync my desktop Firefox data to my Android phone, a Samsung Galaxy S21+. In every help topic I read, it says to click the three dots on Android, go to settings and click "Sync and save data," then click "Ready to scan" and scan the QR code provided from my desktop account. The issue I am running into is that the "Sync and save data" option does not exist on my Firefox Android app. If I click on my profile on the phone, I can click "Sync" but it doesn't do anything. It does not work if I try to scan the QR code through the phone camera instead. I am at a loss for how to sync my Mozilla account on these two devices. My Firefox app is up to date. If anyone can help me I would appreciate it.
creator: katelynbreen
